definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: They are gorgeously captivating and comparable to that of legendary cruisers, and customized choppers.
sentences.chinese: 他們華麗的迷人和相若的傳奇巡洋艦和定製的摩托車。

sentences.english: The bottom of the range is close to the company's net asset value.
sentences.chinese: 招股價下限和每股資產淨值相若。

sentences.english: The average annual growth rate of domestic households is calculated using the similar formula.
sentences.chinese: 家庭住戶的平均每年增長率也是採用相若公式計算。

sentences.english: It sounds like we share similar views on LOVE.
The directors consider that the carrying amount of other payables approximates their fair value.
sentences.chinese: 董事會認爲，其他應付款的賬面值與公平值相若。

sentences.english: Student performance on the whole was similar to last year's.
sentences.chinese: 學生整體表現和去年相若。

definition: not at all the same/substantially different
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
fall short by a large amount
to refuse to concede/not to give in
variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
erhua variant of 頂尖|顶尖[ding3 jian1]
more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)
to be evident at a glance (idiom)
